t: Matthew 17
Jesus Transfigured on the Mount
Now*p after six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John his brother, led them up on a high mountain by themselves;
and He was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and His clothes became as white as the light.
And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with Him.
Then Peter answered and said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here; if You wish, let us make here three tabernacles: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
While*p he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them; and suddenly a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. Hear Him!”
And when the disciples heard it,*i they fell on their faces and were greatly afraid.
But Jesus came and touched them and said, “Arise,*r and*r do*r not*r be*r afraid.”*r
When they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no one but Jesus only.
Now*p as they came down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, “Tell*r the*r vision*r to*r no*r one*r until*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r risen*r from*r the*r dead.”*r
And*p His disciples asked Him, saying, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
Jesus*p answered and said to them, “Indeed,*r Elijah*r is*r coming*r first*r and*r will*r restore*r all*r things.*r

But*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r Elijah*r has*r come*r already,*r and*r they*r did*r not*r know*r him*r but*r did*r to*r him*r whatever*r they*r wished.*r Likewise*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r also*r about*r to*r suffer*r at*r their*r hands.”*r
Then the disciples understood that He spoke to them of John the Baptist.
A Boy Is Healed
And*p when they had come to the multitude, a man came to Him, kneeling down to Him and saying,
“Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is an epileptic and suffers severely; for he often falls into the fire and often into the water.
So I brought him to Your disciples, but they could not cure him.”

Then*p Jesus answered and said, “O*r faithless*r and*r perverse*r generation,*r how*r long*r shall*r I*r be*r with*r you?*r How*r long*r shall*r I*r bear*r with*r you?*r Bring*r him*r here*r to*r Me.”*r
And Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of him; and the child was cured from that very hour.
Then*p the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why could we not cast it out?”

So*p Jesus said to them, “Because*r of*r your*r unbelief;*r for*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r if*r you*r have*r faith*r as*r a*r mustard*r seed,*r you*r will*r say*r to*r this*r mountain,*r ‘Move*r from*r here*r to*r there,’*r and*r it*r will*r move;*r and*r nothing*r will*r be*r impossible*r for*r you.*r
However,*r this*r kind*r does*r not*r go*r out*r except*r by*r prayer*r and*r fasting.”*r
Jesus Again Predicts His Death and Resurrection
Now*p while they were staying in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r about*r to*r be*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r men,*r
and*r they*r will*r kill*r Him,*r and*r the*r third*r day*r He*r will*r be*r raised*r up.”*r And they were exceedingly sorrowful.
Peter and His Master Pay Their Taxes
When*p they had come to Capernaum, those who received the temple*i tax came to Peter and said, “Does your Teacher not pay the temple*i tax?”

He*p said, “Yes.” And*p when he had come into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying, “What*r do*r you*r think,*r Simon?*r From*r whom*r do*r the*r kings*r of*r the*r earth*r take*r customs*r or*r taxes,*r from*r their*r sons*r or*r from*r strangers?”*r
Peter*p said to Him, “From strangers.” Jesus*p said to him, “Then*r the*r sons*r are*r free.*r

Nevertheless,*r lest*r we*r offend*r them,*r go*r to*r the*r sea,*r cast*r in*r a*r hook,*r and*r take*r the*r fish*r that*r comes*r up*r first.*r And*r when*r you*r have*r opened*r its*r mouth,*r you*r will*r find*r a*r piece*r of*r money;*r take*r that*r and*r give*r it*r to*r them*r for*r Me*r and*r you.”*r
